questions.question: If $y$ varies directly as $x$, and $y=6$ when $x=9$, which equation describes this variation?
questions.explanation: Direct variation: $y = kx$. $6 = k \cdot 9 \rightarrow k = \frac{2}{3}$, so $y = \frac{2}{3}x$.

questions.question: If $y$ varies directly as $x$, and $y=7$ when $x=14$, what is $x$ when $y=18$?
questions.explanation: $y = kx$, $7 = k(14) \rightarrow k = \frac12$. Then $18 = \frac12 x \rightarrow x = 36$.
